speaker: KING
text_entry: ACT I

speaker: KING
text_entry: SCENE I. Orchard of Oliver's house.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Enter ORLANDO and ADAM

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: As I remember, Adam, it was upon this fashion

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: bequeathed me by will but poor a thousand crowns,

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: and, as thou sayest, charged my brother, on his

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: blessing, to breed me well: and there begins my

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: sadness. My brother Jaques he keeps at school, and

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: report speaks goldenly of his profit: for my part,

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: he keeps me rustically at home, or, to speak more

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: properly, stays me here at home unkept; for call you

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: that keeping for a gentleman of my birth, that

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: differs not from the stalling of an ox? His horses

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: are bred better; for, besides that they are fair

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: with their feeding, they are taught their manage,

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: and to that end riders dearly hired: but I, his

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: brother, gain nothing under him but growth; for the

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: which his animals on his dunghills are as much

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: bound to him as I. Besides this nothing that he so

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: plentifully gives me, the something that nature gave

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: me his countenance seems to take from me: he lets

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: me feed with his hinds, bars me the place of a

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: brother, and, as much as in him lies, mines my

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: gentility with my education. This is it, Adam, that

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: grieves me; and the spirit of my father, which I

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: think is within me, begins to mutiny against this

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: servitude: I will no longer endure it, though yet I

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: know no wise remedy how to avoid it.

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Yonder comes my master, your brother.

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Go apart, Adam, and thou shalt hear how he will

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: shake me up.

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Enter OLIVER

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: Now, sir! what make you here?

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Nothing: I am not taught to make any thing.

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: What mar you then, sir?

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Marry, sir, I am helping you to mar that which God

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: made, a poor unworthy brother of yours, with idleness.

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: Marry, sir, be better employed, and be naught awhile.

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Shall I keep your hogs and eat husks with them?

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: What prodigal portion have I spent, that I should

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: come to such penury?

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: Know you where your are, sir?

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: O, sir, very well; here in your orchard.

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: Know you before whom, sir?

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Ay, better than him I am before knows me. I know

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: you are my eldest brother; and, in the gentle

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: condition of blood, you should so know me. The

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: courtesy of nations allows you my better, in that

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: you are the first-born; but the same tradition

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: takes not away my blood, were there twenty brothers

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: betwixt us: I have as much of my father in me as

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: you; albeit, I confess, your coming before me is

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: nearer to his reverence.

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: What, boy!

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Come, come, elder brother, you are too young in this.

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: Wilt thou lay hands on me, villain?

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: I am no villain; I am the youngest son of Sir

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Rowland de Boys; he was my father, and he is thrice

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: a villain that says such a father begot villains.

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: Wert thou not my brother, I would not take this hand

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: from thy throat till this other had pulled out thy

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: tongue for saying so: thou hast railed on thyself.

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Sweet masters, be patient: for your father's

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: remembrance, be at accord.

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: Let me go, I say.

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: I will not, till I please: you shall hear me. My

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: father charged you in his will to give me good

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: education: you have trained me like a peasant,

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: obscuring and hiding from me all gentleman-like

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: qualities. The spirit of my father grows strong in

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: me, and I will no longer endure it: therefore allow

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: me such exercises as may become a gentleman, or

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: give me the poor allottery my father left me by

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: testament; with that I will go buy my fortunes.

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: And what wilt thou do? beg, when that is spent?

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: Well, sir, get you in: I will not long be troubled

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: with you; you shall have some part of your will: I

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: pray you, leave me.

speaker: ORLANDO
text_entry: I will no further offend you than becomes me for my good.

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: Get you with him, you old dog.

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Is 'old dog' my reward? Most true, I have lost my

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: teeth in your service. God be with my old master!

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: he would not have spoke such a word.

speaker: ADAM
text_entry: Exeunt ORLANDO and ADAM

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: Is it even so? begin you to grow upon me? I will

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: physic your rankness, and yet give no thousand

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: crowns neither. Holla, Dennis!

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: Enter DENNIS

speaker: DENNIS
text_entry: Calls your worship?

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: Was not Charles, the duke's wrestler, here to speak with me?

speaker: DENNIS
text_entry: So please you, he is here at the door and importunes

speaker: DENNIS
text_entry: access to you.

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: Call him in.

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: Exit DENNIS

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: 'Twill be a good way; and to-morrow the wrestling is.

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: Enter CHARLES

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: Good morrow to your worship.

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: Good Monsieur Charles, what's the new news at the

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: new court?

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: There's no news at the court, sir, but the old news:

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: that is, the old duke is banished by his younger

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: brother the new duke; and three or four loving lords

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: have put themselves into voluntary exile with him,

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: whose lands and revenues enrich the new duke;

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: therefore he gives them good leave to wander.

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: Can you tell if Rosalind, the duke's daughter, be

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: banished with her father?

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: O, no; for the duke's daughter, her cousin, so loves

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: her, being ever from their cradles bred together,

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: that she would have followed her exile, or have died

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: to stay behind her. She is at the court, and no

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: less beloved of her uncle than his own daughter; and

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: never two ladies loved as they do.

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: Where will the old duke live?

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: They say he is already in the forest of Arden, and

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: a many merry men with him; and there they live like

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: the old Robin Hood of England: they say many young

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: gentlemen flock to him every day, and fleet the time

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: carelessly, as they did in the golden world.

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: What, you wrestle to-morrow before the new duke?

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: Marry, do I, sir; and I came to acquaint you with a

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: matter. I am given, sir, secretly to understand

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: that your younger brother Orlando hath a disposition

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: to come in disguised against me to try a fall.

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: To-morrow, sir, I wrestle for my credit; and he that

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: escapes me without some broken limb shall acquit him

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: well. Your brother is but young and tender; and,

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: for your love, I would be loath to foil him, as I

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: must, for my own honour, if he come in: therefore,

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: out of my love to you, I came hither to acquaint you

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: withal, that either you might stay him from his

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: intendment or brook such disgrace well as he shall

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: run into, in that it is a thing of his own search

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: and altogether against my will.

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: Charles, I thank thee for thy love to me, which

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: thou shalt find I will most kindly requite. I had

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: myself notice of my brother's purpose herein and

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: have by underhand means laboured to dissuade him from

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: it, but he is resolute. I'll tell thee, Charles:

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: it is the stubbornest young fellow of France, full

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: of ambition, an envious emulator of every man's

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: good parts, a secret and villanous contriver against

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: me his natural brother: therefore use thy

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: discretion; I had as lief thou didst break his neck

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: as his finger. And thou wert best look to't; for if

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: thou dost him any slight disgrace or if he do not

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: mightily grace himself on thee, he will practise

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: against thee by poison, entrap thee by some

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: treacherous device and never leave thee till he

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: hath ta'en thy life by some indirect means or other;

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: for, I assure thee, and almost with tears I speak

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: it, there is not one so young and so villanous this

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: day living. I speak but brotherly of him; but

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: should I anatomize him to thee as he is, I must

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: blush and weep and thou must look pale and wonder.

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: I am heartily glad I came hither to you. If he come

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: to-morrow, I'll give him his payment: if ever he go

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: alone again, I'll never wrestle for prize more: and

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: so God keep your worship!

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: Farewell, good Charles.

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: Exit CHARLES

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: Now will I stir this gamester: I hope I shall see

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: an end of him; for my soul, yet I know not why,

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: hates nothing more than he. Yet he's gentle, never

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: schooled and yet learned, full of noble device, of

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: all sorts enchantingly beloved, and indeed so much

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: in the heart of the world, and especially of my own

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: people, who best know him, that I am altogether

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: misprised: but it shall not be so long; this

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: wrestler shall clear all: nothing remains but that

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: I kindle the boy thither; which now I'll go about.

speaker: OLIVER
text_entry: Exit
